title: How many seconds of copyrighted video can I use? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to guarantee that everything’s legally above board, you can’t use any material copyrighted to somebody else without their explicit written permission. So the simplest answer to your question is “none”. However, you might be able to claim “fair use” under certain very limited circumstances, but it’s a term that’s widely misused. Contrary to what many YouTube uploaders seem to think, “fair use” does not grant you the right to publish a complete work, and while it’s rather charming seeing people who do this affirming that they don’t own the copyright, that may well make things harder for them if they’re sued because they’ve conveniently affirmed upfront that they were aware that someone else owned the copyright! On the other hand, if you use a very short extract in a clearly educational/critical/parodic context, you might be able to claim “fair use”, but you must use no more footage than is necessary to make your immediate point and you must clearly have gone to the effort of adding such contextualisation (for instance, it’s not good enough just to upload something and tag it “for educational use” - you have to go to the effort of actually providing that education). You’ll see from this that most YouTube videos tagged “fair use” are nothing of the kind, and it’s important to realise that yours might not qualify either, even if you’ve taken the necessary precautions - because “fair use” is very much a grey area, and a judge could easily go either way. There are also certain companies whose work you should never use under any circumstances because they’re very litigious - Disney being a particularly notorious case in point. (Which doesn’t mean that it’s more acceptable to use the work of less litigious companies - just that you’re much more likely to get sued if you breach Disney’s copyright.)

Without other factors to consider, zero. Even a single screencap of a video is copyright infringement if you don't fit the other three rules of fair use. The “minimal use” rule doesn't set a specific duration, work count, percentage or other metrics. It just wants you to use a small part of the original content within new content of greater weight in the total value of the final creation. While also not replacing the need to watch the original and fitting one of the approved purposes for using someone's content.
